isis.stitle: STEERABLE DRIVE AXLE END UNIT: FABCO - REASSEMBLE - WHEEL BEARINGS, HUB, AND BRAKE DRUM

svcproc.title: WHEEL BEARINGS, HUB, AND BRAKE DRUM

note.para: Use of flanged-end bearing drivers is recommended for the installation of bearings and races. These drivers only apply force to the races of the bearing, preventing damage and maintaining alignment with the shaft and bore. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS.

step1.para: Press both wheel bearing cups into the hub. Thoroughly pack both bearing cones with grease, and coat the inside surfaces of the hub and bearing cups. Install the inner wheel bearing cone and the hub seal in the hub ( Figure 17). Lightly coat the outer surface of the spindle with grease to reduce the chance of the inner wheel bearing cocking upon installation of the hub.

figure.caption: Figure 17. Installing the Inner Wheel Bearing Cone and Seal

step1.para: Grasping the outer circumference of the hub at the 12 and 6 o'clock positions, push the hub straight on to the spindle. If difficulty is encountered, try rocking the hub slightly to free the inner bearing.
Install the outer bearing and adjusting nut.

Tighten the bearing adjusting nut to 50 ft-lbs. (68 N·m) while simultaneously rotating the hub assembly. Loosen the nut and repeat this procedure 2-3 times to ensure that the bearings are seated properly. After the final tightening, back off the nut 1/4 turn ( Figure 18).

Install the wheel bearing lockwasher, and back off the adjusting nut just enough to allow its dowel pin to engage in the lockwasher's closest hole. Install and tighten the locknut to 400 ft-lbs. (542 N·m).
The wheel bearing end play should be checked with a dial indicator as part of the adjustment procedure. The correct end play is .002"-.010" (0.05-0.25 mm).

Install the drive flange shims and drive flange over the drive studs. Install the drive flange locknuts and tighten to 100 ft-lbs. (136 N·m). Install and tighten the flanged axle locknut to 400 ft-lbs. (542 N·m).
Mount the brake drum over the wheel studs.

note.para: Grease all lubrication points before returning the vehicle to service.
